metadata.name: Mirror #1
metadata.description:
I wanted to create "Mirror #1"Â to be a one-of-a-kind and thought-provoking artwork that inspires viewers to go on a self-discovery trip. I created a visually appealing work that transcends place and time by mixing the spontaneity of watercolor with the accuracy of digital photo editing.

The Rorschach test, which I used as a metaphor for one's authentic, naked self, was the source of inspiration for the central motif in "Mirror #1."
 Viewers are driven to explore the complexity of their own personal histories and identities by this abstract, symmetrical inkblot-like image, which recalls the idea of a mirror reflecting our core selves.

I could express myself freely and artistically by using traditional watercolor techniques on paper to produce this piece. 
My intention with "Mirror #1" was to challenge viewers to confront their own perceptions of self and identity while reflecting on the various versions of themselves that have existed throughout their lives.
